contextId.information: Here "city" represents the people. AT: "the people who lived in Jerusalem and defeated them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

AT: "The descendants of Manasseh and Ephraim" or "The men of the tribes of Manasseh and Ephraim" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "city" represents the people. AT: "they attacked the people of the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Israel" represents the people. AT: "When the people of Israel became stronger" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Ephraim" represents the men or the soldiers of the tribe of Ephraim. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Asher" represents the men or the soldiers of the tribe of Asher. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "hand" refers to power of the enemies to hurt Israel. AT: "the power of their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The sound made by a person who suffers is used to describe the pain of the Israelites as they suffer. AT: "as they suffered" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "hand" is a metonym that represents power or control. Also, "Cushan Rishathaim" is a synechdoche that represents his army. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
contextId.quote: into the hand of Cushan Rishathaim

contextId.information: Here "hand" is a metonym for army. AT: "The army of Othniel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "land" represents the people. AT: "the Israelites lived peacefully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "danger" refers to enemies that tried to harm the people of Israel. AT: "He also delivered the people of Israel from their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: He also delivered Israel from danger

contextId.information: Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "hand" refers to Jabin's power over Israel. Yahweh's decision to give Jabin power over them is spoken of as if Yahweh had sold them to Jabin. AT: "Yahweh allowed them to be defeated by the power of Jabin king of Canaan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan

contextId.information: Here "chariots" represents the soldiers who drove the chariots. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Sisera called out all his chariots

contextId.information: Here "chariots" represents the soldiers driving the chariots. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" represents a family. AT: "the family of heber the Kenite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the house of Heber the Kenite

contextId.information: The word "heart" represents a person's emotions. The phrase "My heart goes out to" is a way of saying that Deborah feels gratitude or appreciation. AT: "I appreciate the commanders of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
contextId.quote: My heart goes out to the commanders of Israel

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents thoughts. The people discussing with each other but being unable to decide what they should do is spoken of as if they were searching their heart. AT: "there was a lot of discussing about what they should do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: there were great searchings of heart

contextId.information: Here "heart" represents thoughts. The people discussing with each other but being unable to decide what they should do is spoken of as if they were searching their heart. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:05:15|5:15]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: there were great searchings of heart

contextId.information: Here "Gilead" represents the men from Gilead who should have gone to fight in battle. AT: "The men of Gilead stayed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Meroz" represents the people who lived there. AT: "Curse the people of Meroz" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here "the power of Midian" refers to the people of Midian. AT: "The people of Midian were more powerful than the people of Israel and they oppressed them"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The power of Midian oppressed Israel

contextId.information: Here "Midian" represents the people of Midian. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
In this phrase "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
- Here "my voice" represents what Yahweh commanded. AT: "obeyed my command" or "obeyed me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" represents a family. AT: "in my father's family" or "in my family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
These all represent the people of each tribe. AT: "to the tribes of Asher, Zebulun, and Naphtali" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Midian" represents the Midianite army. AT: "The Midianite army set up their camp to the north of the Israelite army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: The camp of Midian was to their north

contextId.information: Here "number" represents the army. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "and there, I will show you who to send home so the army will have less men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: and I will make their number smaller for you there

contextId.information: Here "camp" refers to the whole Midianite army. AT: "Attack the Midianites at their camp, for I am going to help you defeat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
contextId.quote: Attack the camp, for I am going to give you victory over it

contextId.information: Here "the sword of Gideon" refers to Gideon's army attacking.  AT: "The loaf of barley bread in your dream must be the army of Gideon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: This is nothing other than the sword of Gideon

contextId.information: Here "sword" refers to their attack with the use of the sword. AT: "Yahweh caused every Midianite man to fight against his fellow soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Yahweh set every Midianite man's sword against his comrades

contextId.information: Here "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Midian" represents the people of Midian. AT: "of the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "land" represents the people of Israel. AT: "So the Israelites lived peacefully" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "the days" refers to his lifetime. AT: "during the life of Gideon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. AT: "from the power of all their enemies" or "from all their enemies" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: from the hand of all their enemies

contextId.information: Here "your bone and your flesh" represents being someone's relative. AT: "I am a member of your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I am your bone and your flesh

contextId.information: Here "house" represents a temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" represents Gideon's family. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. AT: "from the power of the Midianites" or "from the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: out of the hand of Midian

contextId.information: Here "house" represents family. AT: "my father's family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" refers to family. AT: "his family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" represents a temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Shechem" represents the people of Shechem. AT: "they hid in order to attack the people of Shechem by surprise" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: they set an ambush against Shechem

contextId.information: Here "he" refers to Abimelech who represents all of his soldiers. AT: "they attacked" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Abimelech" represents his soldiers. AT: "Abimelech and his soldiers fought ... They tore down" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here this represents a temple. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hand" represents power or control. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "house" refers to people living in the house. AT: "my family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here the word refers to the King of Ammon, who is spoken of here as a metonym for the soldiers of Ammon. AT: "Why have your soldiers come to seize our land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Why have you come with force to take our land

contextId.information: Here "hand" refers to power to defeat in battle. AT: "gave Israel power over Sihon and all his people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: gave Sihon and all his people into the hand of Israel

contextId.information: These men owned seventy donkeys, which they did ride. Here the word "rode" is used instead of "owned." AT: "They owned  seventy donkeys" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "in the sight of Yahweh" represents what Yahweh considers or thinks about something. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:02:11|2:11]]. AT: "what Yahweh said was evil to do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was evil in the sight of Yahweh

contextId.information: Here the word "head" refers to his hair. This can be stated in active form. AT: "No one should ever cut his hair" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: No razor will be used upon his head

contextId.information: Here the word "hand" means control. AT: "the control of the Philistines" or "being under the Philistine's control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This refers to what the man said. AT: "what you have said" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the angel refers to any food that grow on a vine as "coming" from the vine. AT: "anything that grows on a vine" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: anything that comes from the vines

contextId.information: The phrase "your words" refers to what the angel has said. AT: "what you have said comes true" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Possible meanings are 1) this refers to the actual house. AT: "the house your father and his family live in" or 2) "house" refers to the people who live in it. AT: "your family" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "hands" refers to power. AT: "the Philistine's control" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "words" represent what Delilah was saying to Samson. AT: "by what she said to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

They recognized the man by the sound of his voice. Here "speech" refers to his "voice." AT: "they heard the young Levite talking, and they recognized his voice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: they recognized the speech of the young Levite

contextId.information: Micah did not make his gods, rather the craftsman made them. AT: "the gods which I had made for me" or "the gods which a craftsman made for me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The phrase "us hear you say" refers to the Danites hearing Micah speaking about what had happened, but it also includes if they are told by others that he had spoken about what had happened. AT: "let us find out that you have said anything" or "say anything about this" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: let us hear you say anything

contextId.information: Micah did not make his gods, rather a craftsman made them for him. Also, this can be stated in active form. AT: "the things that had been made for Micah" or "Micah's things" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

The father-in-law is suggesting that he strengthen himself by eating. He is also asking him to wait until the afternoon to leave. This can be stated clearly. AT: "Eat some food so you will be strong enough to travel, and wait until afternoon to leave" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: Strengthen yourself, and wait until the afternoon

contextId.information: Here "the ... city" refers to the people in that city. AT: "everyone who was in the city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "eyes" represents a person's thoughts or opinions. AT: "what he considered to be right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: what was right in his own eyes
